head.supplied: 17/6/69 ¶ ¶ Amidst the bustle for the outgoing mail, dear Mr Guilfoyle, I can only briefly acknowledge the receipt of your kind letter of the 12th June. ¶ Let me thank you for the list of the fine p...

div.p: RB MSS 439c, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens, Melbourne.

Amidst the bustle for the outgoing mail, dear Mr Guilfoyle, I can only briefly acknowledge the receipt of your kind letter of the 12th June.
Letter not found. Let me thank you for the list of the fine plants, which I received through your & your fathers kindness recently.
All the varieties of manihot utilissima, which I ever received, proved very impatient to frost. So cuttings of a hardy kind would be quite a boon.

My collection of palms is not large. Seeds have such a short vitality & I get not many from my correspondents. I do not think I have over 50 species, some not named & of most only one specimen. In my young place none but Areca momostochya & Chamaerops humilis have flowered A. caryota closely allied to if not identical with C. ureus grows certainly at Cape York. I have good specimens of it in the Museum, to which full reference will be made in the 6th vol. of the Flora.
citation.
